p: The development of rapid diagnosis is urgently needed during the early stages of an epidemic to enable community-based screening and consistent course development monitoring. During the early stage of the COVID-19 epidemic, diagnosis was based on symptoms and chest radiology. The majority of COVID-19 cases showed bilateral distribution of patchy shadows and ground-glass opacity on CT images. However, 17.9% of non-critically ill patients and 2.9% patients with severe illnesses showed no radiologic abnormality on hospital admission [39].
